website_summaries.verdict: A unique, high-quality baby spoon that's versatile enough for younger and older babies.
pros: Caregivers love the thin, modern, and attractive design of these spoons, and though they are ideal for self-feeding, they also work for adults feeding younger babies as well
They get top marks for quality, durability and a gentle, baby-friendly design

customer_reviews.title: A good idea, but bad implementation
customer_reviews.text: A good idea, but bad implementation: a spoon shows wear and cracks after few days of usage
customer_reviews.author: Customer

customer_reviews.title: My most recommended baby item of all time! YOU NEED THESE, for real!
customer_reviews.text: The best baby spoons on the market!! Incredibly easy for baby to hold and scoop food with. I was shocked that my 4 month old could use this spoon on her own. She's now 6 months old and we use these multiple times a day. They have a textured handle that makes it easy for baby to hold. The tip bends when baby dips it in the food so she can scoop from many angles- perfect for learners. They wash so easily. I have nothing bad to say about them. I recommend them to everyone and bought them as gifts this Christmas. They're that good!
customer_reviews.author: Brittany Q.

customer_reviews.title: NOT for learning how to use a spoon
customer_reviews.text: We did baby led weaning for my son. Once he turned 1 we wanted to introduce spoons. This is not the right spoon for him. The pointed end is to bendable so items fling off once he is able to scoop them up this ending up with an empty spoon. Also, the amount of food that could be held is rather small so he gets frustrated trying to get something to stay on the small surface. This would be best if you were spoon feeding a baby but NOT for a baby learning to spoon feed themselves. It is now in his play kitchen :)
customer_reviews.author: NewAdventures1981

customer_reviews.title: It’s not just a baby spoon
customer_reviews.text: At first when I saw this product, I thought the scoop part of the spoon was oddly shaped. I hesitated to buy but ended up buying it bc of the rave reviews. (Good thing!) My son (6months old) eats so much better!!! It’s easy to guide the spoon into his mouth bc it’s flexible and thin. He takes the spoon and “feeds” himself too as he’s teething it soothes his itchy gums at the same time. The handle is easy to grip for his small hands. Overall, I am a believer. This spoon is amazing!
customer_reviews.author: shopper

customer_reviews.title: Totally worth it
customer_reviews.text: At first, I was skeptical about these spoons - they looked flimsy and like they would bend too easily without picking up food. I was wrong. These are really well designed, and because they are made of silicone, I'm not afraid he's going to poke his eye out (like I was with the hard plastic spoons) when he tries to feed himself. Worth every cent - I will be buying more.
customer_reviews.author: Larissa

customer_reviews.title: Can not recommend them enough
customer_reviews.text: Only have had these spoons 2 days and my 11 month old son is feeding himself. We have struggled with other plastic spoons that were too long for him to use. He loves these spoons! Can not recommend them enough. I was very worried purchasing these because they are a little pricey, but all the great reviews convinced me and I am so glad I purchased them. Makes feeding him easier since his has a senestive gag reflex feeding himself has helped make it easier.
customer_reviews.author: Alyssa S.

customer_reviews.title: Good to chew, but too bendable and messy
customer_reviews.text: My daughter is 1 yr old and after a few minutes of scooping, she just wants to chew on it because it's rubbery like a teether. Also, because they are so bendable, she usually ends up slinging puree across the room because they act like a slingshot. I have to guide her the entire time, or else food goes everywhere.
customer_reviews.author: R

customer_reviews.title: Best baby spoons ever.
customer_reviews.text: Loved these spoons! They are soft enough for my baby to chew on and play with but firm enough he can’t bite pieces off. They’re easy for him to grip too. He’s 5months old and we started him on oatmeal using these. He wasn’t keen on the baby foods but liked the spoons. There’s nothing hard or sharp that can cause him harm in his mouth if he bites down on it trying to eat. They’re super easy to wash. Microwaveable and dishwasher safe. And they stand upright- suction down to flat surfaces. Plus they’re so adorable. Perfect spoons! Will def order more.
customer_reviews.author: C.C.

customer_reviews.title: Worth the splurge, baby doesn’t hurt herself
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these for my 4th baby (I don’t purchase much for her!!) & they were well worth the splurge! I’m fact I often clean them by hand (vs dishwasher) because I love to use them for every meal. The top is soft so She doesn’t gag herself like she does w/baby metal spoons. When she’s finished eating she used it for teething while I clean up, win-win! I wondered if these were hollow down into the spoon, they are not I’ll be purchasing these for baby gifts in the future.
customer_reviews.author: CK

customer_reviews.title: helpful for first foods
customer_reviews.text: These spoons are spectacular. The soft tips and easy grip handles allow you to hand them to your baby without any fear they will hurt themselves. I think this really helped my baby acclimate to solid foods because she had so much fun grabbing them and chewing the spoons. Doing that in the presence of first foods makes a very positive association with eating. Unfortunately, they are a bit overpriced. Also, I wish they came in a pack of 3 since there is a very useful 3-spoon technique where the baby holds a spoon in each hand and you load a third spoon and trade the spoon with one of their hands.
customer_reviews.author: Amy

customer_reviews.title: Dangerous
customer_reviews.text: Dangerous?!?! I used one of the spoons from the pack of 2 maybe 2-3 times to introduce foods to my 6month old. I looked closely at it today and it had multiple cracks where food would go. Thank god I noticed and it didn’t break apart in her mouth. She has no teeth and was not using it as a teething device.
customer_reviews.author: Alice from Wonderland

customer_reviews.title: These are a win in my house!
customer_reviews.text: I fed my first her initial cereal via a bottle many years ago, now with a pediatrician who recommends against this practice I sought out these spoons as an alternative with reservations. My babe loved slurping off the spoon much to my amazement and she ate well. She's only "eating" once a day at this point, but doesn't have any difficulty grasping the spoons. I didn't really buy these as teethers so I can't give feedback on that aspect other than they do seem soft enough to massage while firm enough to help.
customer_reviews.author: CinTX

customer_reviews.title: Great idea, hard for baby to use
customer_reviews.text: I love the super soft flexible tip, but the shape of the spoon prevents much of any food from being on the spoon, so it becomes more just another chew toy than a tool for my baby to practice putting food in his mouth... the silicone is so slick I can barely give it a light "coating" of food, it just drips off by the time the kid gets it to his mouth, and the basin part is so shallow (and I understand why), that no food is really held there either. I really like the idea of these and I would probably get them again, they just arent the best they could be
customer_reviews.author: Chuu Mong

customer_reviews.title: Great early feeding spoon for teethers!
customer_reviews.text: I have been very pleased with these spoons. Gave one to my DIL since she mentioned that granddaughter had been fussy during solid feedings with firmer spoons against her sore gums while in her teething phase. I kept one for when she visits our home. Our 7 month old granddaughter LOVES THIS SPOON! It is firm enough to hold food, yet the silicone is pliable enough to be comfortable for her to “chew on” once her feeding is completed. She loves it...and so do we! Easy to clean and use.
customer_reviews.author: docmom

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for teething and BLW
customer_reviews.text: I would highly recommend this spoon, we had a few other kinds of spoons gifted to us from our baby shower but this one fits in my baby's mouth with ease, it's used as a teether when he's feeling pain, and it's so easy for him to grab and teach himself how to feed himself. This spoon also suctions at the bottom so it can stand on it's own. It's so easy to clean and I first thought it was too expensive for a baby spoon, but this is the only kind that our baby LOVES. We love it too, it's easy to feed him with this one!!
customer_reviews.author: Joy Wu

customer_reviews.title: Best baby spoons
customer_reviews.text: These are great! Baby loves them and feeds herself so well with these. We started baby led weaning with these at 6 months and she was a pro after just a few times. We actually use both at the same time. We put food on one and give it to our baby to put in her mouth while we put food on the second one, she then swops for the next bite. It’s easy to grip and has a soft tip if the does miss her month. The way it’s made, she also doesn’t seem to put it too far into her mouth to gag. Is highly recommended these.
customer_reviews.author: Jordans

customer_reviews.title: Baby loved it, probably ate some of it.
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to hold and easy to use, but after receiving it on Feb 14 it was done by March 2. My baby doesn't even have teeth yet. I don't know where the missing piece went, and it probably would pass right through the baby, but I am not longer comfortable using it with my baby.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Bonner

customer_reviews.title: Worth the price
customer_reviews.text: I bought this and then also some basic plastic baby spoons. The plastic spoons cost a quarter the price, and even still these spoons were worth it. The shape of the spoon somehow leads to way less spillage than normal spoons. Plus, they don't fray at the ends even with a teething baby that bites and tears into everything with his teeth. It's a comfortable and durable spoon with the unexpected benefit of being really easy to feed from because the max amount of food goes form spoon to mouth with this item.
customer_reviews.author: Nina

customer_reviews.title: Don't get where all the hype came from
customer_reviews.text: These were a second set of silicone spoons we decided to add to our collection, the first being from a container set we got as a gift. I read great reviews on these, so expectations were high, even though they were pricey. What a disappointment. It does not clean containers/bowls as well as our old spoons, and it does not seem to be easier to hold for my baby. So far, it's just a really expensive teether that he only occasionally plays with.
customer_reviews.author: Jimmy G

customer_reviews.title: Love these for self feeding
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my 6 month old to start the “baby led weaning” style self feeding. He LOVES these spoons. If I preload it with some mashed food and hold it toward him vertically, he will grab it easily and bring it to his mouth. He will then happily teeth on these spoons for a long time. The only drawback for me is that they do pick up lint or dust easily when he drops them on the ground, but they’re still 100% worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Mitri

customer_reviews.title: Great first spoons
customer_reviews.text: I love these spoons. My son can chew on any part of them and not hurt his gums or new teeth. He was able to hold them at 6 months easily and enjoys bringing food to his own mouth and self feeding which is awesome to see! I thought I would be spoon feeding him at the beginning but he insists on feeding himself. I'm sure these spoons' shape/material have something to do with that. They are easy to clean. For the price, I wish it came as a pack of 4 spoons, but I still give this product 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Joy A

customer_reviews.title: Gentle on baby gums and teeth and work very well as a spoon
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love these spoons for my baby! I have used these for the past 3 months (he is 9 months now). The flexible spoon part is great for getting every last dollop of food and is also so gentle on his gums and teeth. The tip gently bends so I don’t find that he gags like he does with other spoons when he tries feeding himself. They have held up well in the dishwasher and are great as a teething/chew toy, too! I have a few different styles of baby spoons and think these are definitely worth the extra few dollars.
customer_reviews.author: A1437W

customer_reviews.title: pricy but worth it
customer_reviews.text: I decided to bite the bullet and spend $15 on two tiny spoons but turns out that's really all I need. Better to have two perfect spoons than a bunch of useless ones. I'm one of those people who get quite bothered by spilled food which makes feeding a baby an interesting personal challenge for me. With the popular hard plastic/silicone baby spoons I could barely get the food into my baby's mouth unless it's super runny that the food just slips out of the spoon. This product solves that problem. I followed some advice from the reviews here and just put some peanut butter in the spoon and let the baby feed himself. Works very well.
customer_reviews.author: B. Zhu

customer_reviews.title: A definite must for babies beginning solids...
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this on a whim and I am so glad that I did. My almost 6 month old daughter started eating solids a few weeks ago. On the first day of her attempting solid foods, I used this spoon. She immediately grabbed it out of my hand and loves to try to feed herself. I couldn't believe how easy it was for her to use. I still have to scoop the food on (she's still so little), but she grabs the spoon and feeds herself. This is an excellent training spoon. I actually bought another set, after my initial purchase, so that I can send these training spoons with her to daycare.
customer_reviews.author: Kristin

customer_reviews.title: Converted
customer_reviews.text: I did not understand the hype around these spoons at all. They seemed expensive and were odd looking, I questioned if they would be sharp based on the shape etc. But I am converted! This is our favorite spoon BY FAR. It’s easy for my baby to hold on to, he’s able to feed himself which he prefers, it’s short so he can’t choke or gag himself, and it’s held up well to his gnawing on it as he is teething. We bought more when they were on a lightning deal but I would pay full price (and did originally). Worth the money for us for sure.
customer_reviews.author: Amazonreview

customer_reviews.title: Pricey but perfect
customer_reviews.text: These are perfect. My daughter has been interested in trying to feed herself since we first introduced solids. Other spoons were too long to control (Munchkin) or too wide for her mouth (Beaba). Now that she's 15 months old, these are the only spoons we use. They allow her to successfully scoop up anything from purees and chia pudding to rice and corn. They're very durable and incredibly easy to wash. In addition to being functional for self-feeding, I love that you can stand them up to keep them clean. Other than the price (way higher than other brands), there are no downsides!
customer_reviews.author: AZ

customer_reviews.title: Our baby loves these!
customer_reviews.text: Our 9-month old (Lazer) loves these spoons! He rarely gets the food into his mouth but who gives a rip! He loves holding it and waving it around, spraying everything within three feet of him with food and they make him laugh and smile. He also likes to chew on them so they're helpful for teething too.
customer_reviews.author: Lauren R.

customer_reviews.title: worth every penny!
customer_reviews.text: I love the design of this spoon and the fact that you get 2, one for baby to chew on while mom feeds with the other! At first I thought it was a little pricey for a spoon but now that I have them, I think they are worth every penny! Like a regular silicone spatula you can scrape every bit of food lining the bowl, they are just the right size for both mom & baby and baby can play with and chew on one without worry. They are much better than the longer, harder spoons you buy at the store. I HIGHLY RECOMMEND!
customer_reviews.author: BarbS

customer_reviews.title: Love them
customer_reviews.text: At first glance I thought it was another useless baby gadget but once I saw a video of them being used I knew I had to try them. They are super soft and pliable so it's gentle as they try to get it into their mouth. They are also the perfect size for baby to grip. They are great to chew on for a teething baby as well! I love the design and will definitely be ordering more to have on hand.
customer_reviews.author: Jenna Parent

customer_reviews.title: Great spoon!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great spoon. It is flexible making cleaning the bowl or LO face very easy, sticks to table tops so LO can't knock it over, and easy to hold in LO's hands. Additionally it is easy to clean and dries quickly. My LO loved it the first time I gave it to him. He would try to put it in his mouth. Perfect for his little hands! One thing that would be nice is if there was a way to tie a clip to this so if LO attempted to throw it it would not hit the floor.
customer_reviews.author: Sharlyne

customer_reviews.title: SON LOVE THEM
customer_reviews.text: My son loves to chew on them and I don't worry about him poking his eye out when he is play with them/ trying to sort of feed himself! They are very flexible so be prepared you might want to have a heavier baby spoon if you are assisting feeding them. But this is a great spoon for then to learn how to use it them selves with giving you peace of mind that they are not going to hurt themselves in the process.
customer_reviews.author: Charles Wilson Hassold Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Not new.
customer_reviews.text: Did not get to try them. Packaging appears to have been previously opened. Sealers at openings torn/pealed off. Not risking it with a baby. Returning.
customer_reviews.author: M. Hoover

customer_reviews.title: Best starter spoons out there!
customer_reviews.text: These starter spoons are The BEST! We’ve been using theses spoons for a few months now and they have been so perfect we ordered another set. They are super easy to clean, great for my baby who wants to put the spoon in her own mouth. They are easy for her to hold and we’re right from the beginning. She is now getting her second tooth and loves to chew on these for comfort. They make feeding so easy from the start. My daughter is now 7 1/2 months and still prefers these spoons to any other. Definitely buy these spoons you will not regret it! They have help up perfectly! Would buy again and again.
customer_reviews.author: Michele

customer_reviews.title: Great first spoon
customer_reviews.text: My daughter wanted to be in control of the spoon from the second we started her on solids at 6 months. We tried 3 or 4 different types of spoons and these were by far the best combination of something a) that held some food if she was turning it in a million directions, b) she could actually control enough to get in her mouth and c) were the least likely to fling puree all the way across the room when she inevitably started banging and waving her arms around.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Ingrassia

customer_reviews.title: Great for learning, teething and lasts!
customer_reviews.text: We bought these for my one year old 3 months ago. It's both our favorite and my girls favorite! The grip is great and the way the spoon bends getting the food is really helpful for my babe who is learning to use utensils. Cleaning is easy and they look brand new still, even after daily use AND we've let my babe knaw on it while teething multiple times with her 4 (and now 7) teeth. We only originally bought the one pack of two to try out and now plan to buy another pack just so we don't have to wash quite as often if we're not easily able. Love!
customer_reviews.author: Angela

customer_reviews.title: Feeding him with these can be a bit tricky because the tips are so flexible that he can easily flick the tip of the spoon out of his ...
customer_reviews.text: My baby loves to chew on these spoons. Feeding him with these can be a bit tricky because the tips are so flexible that he can easily flick the tip of the spoon out of his mouth and spray food across the room. They work really well as teethers, and it doesn't seem like my baby will be able to chew bits of the spoon off as his teeth come in. It's also kind of nice that they stand up on their own, although I usually just rest the spoon in the bowl anyway so there's no need to stand them up.
customer_reviews.author: E. Armstrong

customer_reviews.title: Baby & I absolutely LOVE these spoons! Perfect for Baby-led Weaning
customer_reviews.text: They're the perfect size for little hands, so easy to hold on to and feed himself, other baby spoons are too long and get caught on things. The spoon tip holds food really well, more of scoop than a spoon, so it doesn't spill out as easy. Also baby loves chewing on them for teething relief. I have other baby spoons but I always use these because baby definitely prefers them.
customer_reviews.author: E. B.

customer_reviews.title: Great little feeding spoons especially for new eaters
customer_reviews.text: This is my second order of these spoons. I like the shape and size of them and they are just the right consistency in terms of flexibility and softness without being too much of either. My baby likes to hold the spoon and chew on it a little after eating since he’s currently teething. They do seem like they might be a tad overpriced for what they are. I feel like they would be a much better deal if the two-pack was $10 or less.
customer_reviews.author: Dacia Gulledge

customer_reviews.title: Highly Recommend
customer_reviews.text: These spoons are great for little hands! My 16 month old loves these. She can grip them better than regular spoons, and gets more food on the spoon and in her mouth than with regular baby spoons. She has less frustration, so will use them longer trying to eat with the spoon. They clean well in the top rack of the dishwasher. I haven't seen any wear and tear issues.
customer_reviews.author: BlueSky

customer_reviews.title: Good beginner/training spoon for purees
customer_reviews.text: The spoon seems durable so far. My little one can chew on it and I haven't seen any tears in it. As a spoon, this item is best used for purees or mashed up food. It's the perfect size for their little hands. The spoon tip is a little too bendy for digging into really thick mashed foods. This spoon personally does not work for my child as she prefers to chew on other things and does not like eating purees or mashed foods.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer

customer_reviews.title: First use tonight of many!
customer_reviews.text: Baby tried these for the first time tonight. And went crazy! Loved using them for teething. As this was during supper, he did get some food to his mouth also. I was surprised at how well it scooped food even without an edge to scoop against. Also, it's great that they come 2 to a pack so that you can entice baby away from teething on one by preloading the other.
customer_reviews.author: SDref

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use & long lasting
customer_reviews.text: Feels the same as the first day bought since made out of silicone. It's flexible and easy to feed baby with this spoon. It's just the right size, food doesn't go all over the place like with other spoons (where they put too much & doesn't funnel into baby's mouth). Baby can also easily hold and chew on for teething. Food does get on the stem (when resting on bowl rim) and therefore on your fingers (short handle), which gets annoying but I still rather use this spoon than longer stemmed, stiffer spoons. Have and bought several of these (easy to clean too).
customer_reviews.author: Karen T

customer_reviews.title: Practical Design
customer_reviews.text: The unique design of these spoons is wonderful for baby. The flexible silicone and pointed, leaf-shaped tip create perfect-sized bites, and enable baby to eat all of the food on the spoon. It seems like with other, rigid baby spoons, babies can’t ever seem to get a full bite. With these spoons, it’s easy, and it’s also easy to scrape the bottom of the bowl or plate for less food-waste. We started with these spoons with the first introduction to purées and solids around 3-4 mos old, and baby took to them immediately. They’re easy to wash, so one set has been sufficient, which may help offset the higher price tag.
customer_reviews.author: Gabriela

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable on little gums
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these spoons after using a well known brand that is made of a harder plastic. My son likes to hold a spoon whilst I am feeding him and was constantly jabbing the back of his throat and chewing down for comfort. I instantly searched for a softer spoon and came across these. I love that they’re ergonomically designed for little hands to hold and that they also double up as a teether. I just wish they weren’t as pricey. I definitely recommend to all parents!
customer_reviews.author: Mrs D Holleran Laping

customer_reviews.title: Would not recommend-spoon design hazardous
customer_reviews.text: I felt as if the spoon part of this was to long. When the baby held and put in her mouth the point went to far in causing her to gag. When using it to feed it was hard to determine how far the point was going in. While every childs mouth size is different the design seem to long and deep. The edge was rounded and not pointy but was not ideal for beginning spoon feeding.
customer_reviews.author: CLC In CP

customer_reviews.title: Fits perfectly in little hands
customer_reviews.text: We haven't used these for feeding yet, but my little guy likes to hold them and chew on them. I was looking for something small that he could fit in his little hand for teething and this is perfect. He's teething pretty bad and we've tried all kinds of different teethers and they all are just too big and bulky and he wants no part of them. But he loves these little spoons. That a win for me. I took one star off because of the price, but I'd gladly pay it again if it help him ease the discomfort.
customer_reviews.author: Kristie

customer_reviews.title: Soft, flexible, easy to clean. Baby loves!
customer_reviews.text: These are perfect for purées, yogurt, etc... The shape and flexibility of the spoon makes it easy to get into the corners and curves of different containers so you can get every last bit of food. My little guy loves chewing on them after he’s done eating. He’s not mastered feeding himself but these spoon are very easy for him to grab and hold onto. I love that I can suction it standing up on the table so the spoon doesn’t touch any surface I don’t want it to. It’s very easy to clean. So glad we got these over traditional baby spoons. I would definitely buy these again and recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Honey R.

customer_reviews.title: Recommend but watch out b/c dogs love them too!
customer_reviews.text: Love these and buying more (lost one to a fur baby). They are super easy to scoop up the last bits of food in the crevices and flat surfaces, easy to clean, easy to hold, easy for travel. I love that they stand up on their own. I love that they are made of silicone - soft for baby's mouth, (mostly*) durable, and safe. Not to mention that they are super cute. We get compliments on them all the time. *No match for a dog but also starting to see some wear (after 6 months of hard use) from the toothy 1 year old too.
customer_reviews.author: Charlene Boyd

customer_reviews.title: Best baby spoon!
customer_reviews.text: These are the best and I wouldn't use any other spoon with my baby! She could hold it really young, before she even started solids, it fits perfectly in her little hands and she instinctively knew how to use it! It's also great for teething and super easy to wash, especially it just needs a little rinse, but also dishwasher safe! I love this spoon!
customer_reviews.author: Isacelia

customer_reviews.title: Cracked in a couple weeks
customer_reviews.text: Super bummed these did not last longer as baby seemed to like this a lot. Have used them less than a month — once a day - and one of them has already cracked. My baby has no teeth so not sure how this happened. Doesn’t seem like there is a return policy beyond 30 days of purchase, regardless of poor workmanship.
customer_reviews.author: SDC

customer_reviews.title: Awesome BLW Utensil
customer_reviews.text: I ordered these for my twins that are in the middle of BLW. These spoons are soft and flexible. They are extremely easy to hold and my girls are able to pick them up and put food into their mouths easily. I have read reviews of people saying that they are splitting, but these are not for teething. I don't let my girls just chew on them and when they are using them, they have my full attention and 100% supervision. We haven't had any issues yet, but we are really enjoying them so far!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Definitely the best spoon for self feeding!
customer_reviews.text: This one is the best!!!!!! I bought several spoons from oxo, babybjorn, ezpz, bumkins before. My boy is 7m now. He loves oxo feeding spoon but it is too large for self feeding. The babybjorn spoon is a hard plastic spoon which is better for toddlers. The ezpz tiny spoon has a perfect size but will become super slippery with cereal on it. The bumkins spoon seems great but my baby prefers to chew on the back side more than the front side. The olababy spoon is the first one he won’t throw away and can easily feed himself!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great learning tool for self-feeding.
customer_reviews.text: I fell in love with these spoons before I purchased them. I could imagine how great they would be for a baby to start self-feeding, and I got what I expected. These are, pretty much, the only spoons I give to my baby for now. They're great for teething, I know they won't hurt her, and she learns to eat with it - a perfect spoon for a learning munchkin.
customer_reviews.author: Irina

customer_reviews.title: Favorite spoons
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love these spoons! My daughter (who’s 10 months) doesn’t have teeth yet, so I’m not sure how they will hold up, but for now she loves them! The food sticks easily enough to the spoon and my daughter loves chewing on them. She’ll grab them from my hand and just chew. It’s very easy to feed her now. Super easy to clean as well. Definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly Holmes

customer_reviews.title: My baby's first spoon and it works great
customer_reviews.text: I chose this as the first spoon for my LO since it has very good review and recommended by other moms. This works great so far. My LO starts solid food around 5 months and without an issue using the spoon. The tip is very soft so that you never need to worry about hurting her gum. She also likes to chew on it. It may feel a bit flat at the beginning but I am adapting to it quickly. It's also super easy to clean without being stained by the puree. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Jing Zhao

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic baby spoon
customer_reviews.text: We LOVE these. They scrape every last bit of food, are gentle on baby's mouth, and easy for him to hold! He quickly learned to put the spoon in his mouth. The suction cup base makes keeping the top of the spoon off dirty surfaces when not in use. These are high quality, super easy to clean, and aesthetically pleasing. A bit high priced but worth it.
customer_reviews.author: S Rose

customer_reviews.title: I’m a fan
customer_reviews.text: Whoever has problems with these spoons must not be hand washing them. I’ve kept them out of the dishwasher and had no issues. They’ve been helpful for my babies to learn to eat. Both in the shape of the handle as well as the spoon part having some give compared to a harder spoon- they can really get the purée or yogurt off well.
customer_reviews.author: SummerPinwheel22

customer_reviews.title: Baby Loves Them!
customer_reviews.text: We purchased these for our 6 month old son to use when starting solids. Even though the first set I ordered never arrived, the replacement set showed up promptly. They are super easy to clean and I love that they are dishwasher safe. My son absolutely loves them-- we load the spoon with food and he grabs the spoon and feeds himself. They are easy to grip and he will happily chew on either end of the spoon! Definitely a win :-)
customer_reviews.author: Rachel Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Easy for baby to hold
customer_reviews.text: We bought these for our baby since he was adamant about feeding himself. We also have the version with longer handles, but somehow baby makes an even bigger mess by grabbing those. Baby loves chewing on these spoon - maybe even more than eating what’s on them. Very easy to clean - we put them in the dishwasher about half the time.
customer_reviews.author: Erin D

customer_reviews.title: Best baby spoons ever
customer_reviews.text: I love these spoons! And so does my baby. As a teether that fits just right, and an intuitive spoon he is more than happy to use if I load it with something yummy. Held just now turning 7 months old, and has snow problems using this spoon if I load it and hand it to him. I'm sure it will be no time before he has mastered loading it himself.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic, wish I had these with my first baby!
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE these and wish I had them for my first baby. My daughter is 8mos old, loves to chew on them, and intuitively knew how to grasp and bring to her mouth. I love how soft these are (yet durable) and happy they came as a set of two so we can always have one in rotation. This is a great spoon to start the journey to food.
customer_reviews.author: SaraMarie

customer_reviews.title: Great spoons
customer_reviews.text: Holy cow we love these! Our daughter loves them too! Easy to hold. She is 6 months and does pretty well getting the food on these to her mouth. And then keeping it in her mouth to gum on for a bit. Makes feeding fun for her even if the super flexible spoons make it easy for her to flick food all over the floor.
customer_reviews.author: SShreve

customer_reviews.title: Totally Waste of Money!!!
customer_reviews.text: 1. Hard to use. I gave this spoon to my baby when she was 8 months old. Now she's 14 months old and she never liked this spoon/used it. But she can use other spoons pretty well. This one just does not work! Even me and my hubby don't like using it. 2. Retains taste of dish soap 3. Pricey. We have oxo, munchkin, skip hop spoons. They all work better than this Olababy spoon and they are way much cheaper.
customer_reviews.author: serendipity

customer_reviews.title: Great first time spoon!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great first spoon!! I have three kids and for the first two I used the usual spoons (nuk brand with the silicone covered metal spoon) and they were fine but the tip of this spoon is so much better for first time feeders. I introduced the Olababy to my son when we started introducing him to solids at 4 months and now at 6 months it’s still the spoon we prefer.
customer_reviews.author: S. Penalver

customer_reviews.title: A great safe and useful product
customer_reviews.text: Our grandson uses these at home so we bought them for when he comes over the house. He's just 2 and it's so easy for him to wield as he eats. The added benefit is that as he teethes - he uses it to help him combat the aches. A great safe and useful product I wish I had for my children when they were young.
customer_reviews.author: John Meehan

customer_reviews.title: Soft, flexible and sturdy. THE BEST SPOON!
customer_reviews.text: These are the BEST baby spoons. Not only are they easy to clean, but food stays on them better than any other spoon I have tried! They are soft and flexible yet sturdy enough for the thickest cereal. They are also widen a bit more at the “stem” vs your average infant spoon so you are able to have more food on the spoon.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie B

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money!
customer_reviews.text: These are on the more expensive side for spoons, but they are totally worth it! The shape of the spoon fits perfectly into my son's (7.5 mo) tiny mouth. This helps for all of the food to be transferred into his mouth, whereas with other spoons, there is always residual leftover on the spoon. We've only had these for about a month, but they seem durable. They are easy to clean. My son also enjoys using it as a teether.
customer_reviews.author: HobbyHobberson

customer_reviews.title: I would recommend
customer_reviews.text: I bought a second pair because I like them so much. I have a 9 month old, but I bought them at about 6 months. They are firm enough for feeding and chewing but soft enough that they won't hurt her mouth or face. She can feed herself with them if I give her the spoon with food on it already.
customer_reviews.author: C. RHODES

customer_reviews.title: The only spoon our baby likes
customer_reviews.text: These are amazing and I recommend them to any new mom I know! We've tried the other popular silicone spoons, and he whines and fusses. These are the only spoons he loves. Easy to use, soft on his gums, and the perfect shape to get most of the food in his mouth and not on his face or front.
customer_reviews.author: For the love of books!!

customer_reviews.title: Great spoon especially for teething baby
customer_reviews.text: The spoon is comfortable and performs well, although it seems a bit flat at first glance, it holds a good amount of food. It is easy to clean and more importantly when it comes in contact with the baby's gums it is gentle, which is paramount in reducing the pain for a teething baby. I bought 2, so when I feed him I give him one to hold and he rubs his gums with it put it in his mouth, helping him also on the way to feeding himself.
customer_reviews.author: Mamie

customer_reviews.title: Best baby spoons!
customer_reviews.text: These are the best baby spoons out there! I also have EZPZ and these are definitely my favorite. The spoon is so flexible and it is easy to get all of the food in baby’s mouth because it is soft and bendable. Also, unlike other baby spoons it fits more food so you can control how much you would like to put on it and as baby gets older they will not outgrow the spoon so fast. Thank you for an awesome product!
customer_reviews.author: LJ

customer_reviews.title: Great for littles learning to feed themselves. Love love love!!
customer_reviews.text: I love these!! Yes, it's a lot to pay for spoons but even though I have a drawer full of other baby spoons, I only use these two. The tip is flexible so when my daughter tries to feed herself, she doesn't gag on it. The handle is also much easier for her to hold and they are the perfect length. Other reviewers commented on an odor but there was not any kind of smell when I opened mine. I'm so glad I bit the bullet and tried them!
customer_reviews.author: Photojenic92

customer_reviews.title: Cute and functional
customer_reviews.text: My 7.5month old likes these. With a 2-pack, We each get to hold one as he is practicing eating. I like that the entire thing is a good material for teething. There is a bit of suction on the bottom which is fun for baby to grab at when I stick it on his tray. Toss them in the dishwasher. Play, they’re Cute. What’s not to like?
customer_reviews.author: LootieWhistle

customer_reviews.title: So great spoon!
customer_reviews.text: My boy starts to play it from 3 months and has used it since 4 months. He loves it and we love it! We have Munchkin Gentle Silicone Spoons too but this one is much better - it is shorter so my boy can place it into his mouth much easily and it is gentle so we are not worried to poke him. You cannot stir things with this spoon as it is soft but not necessary for this age.
customer_reviews.author: Christina

customer_reviews.title: Cute, but food-flingers
customer_reviews.text: Easy to clean and for the little one to hold even when they get slippery - the handle is textured to help with grip and the fact that it narrows in the center keeps their hand from slipping off the end or over the spoon head. However, because they have such flexible tips, a little baby who isn't super precise putting the spoon in/out of their mouth ends up flinging food far and wide!
customer_reviews.author: Mindy

customer_reviews.title: Baby's First Spoon
customer_reviews.text: This training teething spoon set is great. My daughter loves to chew on the soft feel and the length is perfect for her to hold and get used to feeding herself. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Tylor VanDerMoere

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic
customer_reviews.text: It gets a little messy feeling the little one with this oh-so-adorable spoon but it's fine. He loves it whether he is eating from him or playing with it. Very soft and easy to clear the baby's mouth. It would be nice if they made it in different sizes...I would have bought one that is a bit smaller -- I think there would be less of a mess if the feeding part of the spoon was a bit smaller. Regardless....great item.
customer_reviews.author: Damodar

customer_reviews.title: Great for learning how to self feed
customer_reviews.text: I bought these spoons when my daughter was 11 mos and she has been using them for about 6 weeks now. The size of this spoon is short enough that she can pick it up herself and easily navigate it into her bowl. The leaf part of the spoon makes it easy for her to maneuver into her mouth and the shape is also a good teether while she’s eating. Overall a great purchase - I bought 2 sets of these.
customer_reviews.author: Roe

customer_reviews.title: Spoons! Yay!
customer_reviews.text: Wow! Our 4-month old was showing that she wanted to use her hands and was very interested in our food, but we were way too intimidated by baby-led weaning, so when we introduced baby food to her, we tried these spoons. And they are amazing. The spoons allow independence, and food stays on nicely. Sometimes is falls off if she turns it upside down, but she usually grabs the spoon quickly and moves it to her mouth even quicker. She’s nine months now, and we still use the spoons. We bought more to send to the grandparents’ houses as well.
customer_reviews.author: C Lo

customer_reviews.title: I didn't want to love these.
customer_reviews.text: $15 for two baby spoons? I can't believe I spent that much! BUT I love them! My baby loves them! I only wish I'd found them for my first 3 kiddos. If your on the fence BUY IT. I want more, but they're too expensive. If I lose them I'll bite the bullet and buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Kassie

customer_reviews.title: Baby's favorite spoons
customer_reviews.text: I've been trying a number of different training spoons over the past couple of months. These are definitely at the top of the list for my 7 month old eating machine! They're really easy to hold and he loves to chew on them to soothe his poor teething gums in between bites.
customer_reviews.author: Pinksand

customer_reviews.title: The best first spoon!!! Or teether!
customer_reviews.text: LOVE THESE. my five month old is obsessed with these!! She holds them great, teethes on them when I’m getting her food ready, and sucks on it when we are done eating and I have to clean up. She can navigate it to her mouth herself and they’re so bendable and soft so they don’t hurt the inside of her mouth with her forceful movements :) and super easy to clean!
customer_reviews.author: Sam

customer_reviews.title: Best spoons for introducing food to baby
customer_reviews.text: These lasted us a while and were perfect to feed our little one till about 15 months or so after which she started using bigger sized spoons. It was so easy to feed her - she started early when she was about 5 months old.
customer_reviews.author: Dkorator

customer_reviews.title: Great spoon for beginning self-feeders
customer_reviews.text: I bought this spoon for my six month old grandson at the behest of my daughter 3 months ago. This spoon works great for yogurt, purées and other soft foods. The food is put on the spoon, then handed to little Wyatt. He shoves it into his mouth and then spends some time chewing on the spoon after he’s eaten the food. It’s easy for him to hold onto the handle and definitely serves the dual purpose of eating and teething.
customer_reviews.author: Donna B.

customer_reviews.title: Gets the job done
customer_reviews.text: This spoon is perfect for teething. My daughter is able to move it around her mouth to where she needs it with out gagging herself. For feeding, it seems my son is alot messier with this versus the regular spoon. He'll probably do better when he's able to feed himself. Overall, I like the product.
customer_reviews.author: Crystal Carden

customer_reviews.title: The best spoon
customer_reviews.text: This is the best spoon you can use for the baby. I have bought it bc I’ve seen a lot of good reviews and I am very happy with it. My baby start using it with 6 month by herself. Its perfect and gentle for teething. The shape is well made for first time solids. I am very very happy with it. Ordered two packets, one for diaper bag for to go and one pack for home.
customer_reviews.author: marina

customer_reviews.title: Best spoons ever!  Have six and ordered two more!
customer_reviews.text: I love this spoon, we have 6 and I don’t know how anyone would give it less than 5 stars. My baby holds and plays with it, he is learning to feed himself and I don’t worry that he will hurt himself because it is so flexible! Also, the thin edges of the spoon make it easy to clean up spillage from his mount and scrape the sides of the food jar... something other plastic or rubber spoons can’t do as effectively.
customer_reviews.author: Ruth Steer

customer_reviews.title: Great spoons
customer_reviews.text: These spoons are the best! I wish I bought them when I had my first baby. I got them for my second baby and he was able to easily hold it and bring it to his mouth at 6 months! Not only are they easy to hold, wash, the quality is also amazing, my toddler threw the spoon in the sink and it fell into the in sink disposal, I didn’t know so I turned it on then realized there was something in there, the spoon came out completely undamaged
customer_reviews.author: Zahra Amin

customer_reviews.title: Great buy
customer_reviews.text: My daughter LOVES this spoon. It’s easy to use plus it doubles as an excellent teether! After I’ve fed her the majority of her food I pour the remainder in a suctioned bowl, scoop a little, then allow her to hold it/feed herself and it works so well! I am extremely pleased with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: KittenEA

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: My baby girl (10 month old) and I love this. Sometimes she will close her mouth and with other baby spoons I would hit her lips in teeth. With these spoons, if she closes her mouth it does not hurst her as it made of soft silicone on the tip of it. She holds the spoons afterwards and uses as teether. As she learns how to feed herself, this is spoon is perfect since it is soft but sturdy! We love it! I bought a second to give as a gift to my sister!
customer_reviews.author: Rosacarla Ribeiro

customer_reviews.title: The perfect infant spoon!
customer_reviews.text: I got these as a gift for my baby and I’ve already bought more! The PERFECT spoon for teaching the baby to hold their own spoons! My baby figured it out very easily right at 6 months! I scoop for him but then he grabs it and puts it right into his mouth. Soft, easy to scoop, works as a “teether” to chomp on during mealtimes while learning to use it properly.
customer_reviews.author: Jordan Lundee

customer_reviews.title: Our favorite spoon!
customer_reviews.text: Perfect shape for getting the food into the baby’s mouth. My baby seems to be able to keep the food in easily with this spoon. There is less spitting out if that makes sense. The food goes in and stays in (mostly my baby is 4 months old) rather than goes in and spits out.
customer_reviews.author: Veronica Saechao

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for teething baby
customer_reviews.text: My 11 month old daughter is teething and was rejecting food with the baby plastic spoons I was feeding her with. The spoons were hurting her swollen gums. I was stressing over her not wanting to eat. I came across these spoons and they are a life saver! She eats all her food with no fuss, as soon as she’s done I wash the spoon and let her gnaw away. Highly recommended for teething baby!
customer_reviews.author: Maribel B.

customer_reviews.title: baby loves it - feeds herself
customer_reviews.text: These were worth it, despite the relatively high price. The baby is able to easily hold them and was able to feed herself almost right from the beginning. She loves chewing on the spoons after as well. Makes feeding more fun for everyone involved.
customer_reviews.author: BSG

customer_reviews.title: The best teething spoon!
customer_reviews.text: Love these amazing rubber spoons!i bought for my grandson, he is having terrible time teething, he chews on this while he eat , easy for him to hold himself and easy to suck off the spoon foods, all in one , clean up is great to perfect serving to also use for my Daycare Center.
customer_reviews.author: Cheri

customer_reviews.title: How to get your child to use a spoon
customer_reviews.text: I swear this spoon is the reason my 6 month old started feeding herself. She immediately held it and it was like a slingshot to her mouth. I helped her put purées on her spoon while she was holding it and again, it was like a slingshot to her mouth. I had to hold her back from shoving it in her mouth so quickly !! At 7 months now, she’s getting the hang of scooping purées now. Love it and have already sung its praises to my other friends
customer_reviews.author: Thi Lynn Gallen

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for little mouths
customer_reviews.text: Love these spoons WAY more than I anticipated. They're the perfect size for my 6 mo. baby. I also have the bamboo/silicone spoons which are too big for her mouth but these, with the more narrow curved spoon section and a pointy tip, fit perfectly. It's bendy and makes a great squeegee for all the extra goo. Also can pop them in the dishwasher for easy cleanup.
customer_reviews.author: texaseskimo

customer_reviews.title: Great beginner spoon
customer_reviews.text: Just bought for my 4mo old. I have yet to introduce purees, but I have been giving it to her to grasp. She takes the spoon and brings it to her mouth to suck on it. She seems like she is getting the action right for when I do decide to introduce purees.
customer_reviews.author: Molly

customer_reviews.title: Would buy again
customer_reviews.text: My baby really loves these. We have the shorter length and she is able to move the spoon to her mouth easily. The one and only downfall is the spoons have tiny ridges which can collect softer foods if not cleaned well. Regardless, we will most likely purchase another set.
customer_reviews.author: Asia

customer_reviews.title: Great spoons for baby learning to self feed
customer_reviews.text: These spoons are great for babies learning to self feed. I feel like the combination of the shape and silicone help food stay on as baby lifts it to their mouth. My baby also likes the way the silicone feels on his gums and I like that he is not chewing on hard plastic. They are also super easy to clean. I just throw them in the top rack of the dishwasher. Definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Meg

product_meta.title: Olababy 100% Silicone Soft-Tip Training Spoon for Baby Led Weaning 2pack
product_meta.description: The Olababy Training Spoon, made from 100% silicone, is a spoon designed as babies’ first self-feeding spoon. The design inspiration is extracted from natural plant elements – the spoon resembles the shape of a sprout and the tip of the spoon resembles the shape of a leaf. The leafy shape of the tip combined with the flexibility of the silicone material allows the spoon to flex. Babies can perform various motions such as scooping, cutting and slicing with ease. The stem of the silicone spoons are decorated with protruding lines to resemble natural shape of vegetation stems to provide a better grip.
feature_bullets: Flexible material to scoop food at any angle
Spoon base allows for hygienic, upright placement on any surface

specifications.Material free: PVC free, BPA Free, Phthalate Free, Lead free
specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.8 out of 5 stars3,273 ratings4.8 out of 5 stars
